subject: Travel
title: Genghis Khan's Secret Tomb
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Genghis Khan's Secret Tomb.

hook.text: The tomb of the most powerful conqueror in history has never been found. Mongolia forbids searching for it.

buildup.text: Genghis Khan died in 1227. Legend says his funeral escort killed anyone who crossed their path to keep the location secret.

discovery.text: Some accounts say a river was diverted over the grave. Others say 1,000 horses trampled the ground flat.

twist.text: Mongolians consider searching for the tomb deeply disrespectful. A parliamentary law restricts excavation.

climax.text: Satellite and drone technology could find it, but cultural respect has kept the search from proceeding.

punchline.text: Technology could find the tomb. Respect keeps it hidden.

quiz.question: Why hasn't Genghis Khan's tomb been found?
options: Mongolian law and cultural respect restrict the search
